description:
For me this place has the best salmon in town. The salmon sushi is just great. The chunk of salmon is big and the rice is very well done. No doubt, my favorite place for salmon sushi.

Of course the other plates are cool but I just love the salmon sushi.
author: Raúl M.

description:
Not sure why this place inspires either stalwart love or adamant disdain. It's a small neighborhood sushi place, with mid-range prices and an average menu.

I sat at the bar last time and was able to take my time, partially because my sushi took a while to arrive. The place was busy, and the fish freshness was mediocre. Service was fine and unobtrusive, and the local news was on at the bar. 

It's fine for a place that's close by, and I expect to return - though I wouldn't trek here from afar.
author: Novelty B.

description:
This is one of the few places where you can sit and talk without being rushed if you go over two hours...It's casual and the folks working here are super nice. The sushi is delicious and reasonable priced.

I absolutely love this neighborhood spot!
author: Via Fume C.

description:
This little sushi spot is a gem. I went with 3 friends on a Friday night so seating was difficult, but we found space at the bar. Due to it being busy our food took awhile, but when it did it was great! The fish on the sushi was amazingly fresh! 
MThe staff was super nice and to top it off it was very inexpensive. Even with 4 bottles of sake & 4 beers, 3 apps, and 4 rolls our bill was right at $100. Will for sure be returning to this place.
author: Christine O.

description: Very good Service. There is very Yummy food. I will come back soon. Also good for a family Stier.
author: Jenni Z.

description:
So good! Great food and service at a great price. Staff is super friendly. Family environment so service is more relaxed, and such reasonable prices make it all the more endearing.

My go to sushi spot in the area for weeknights!
author: Jonathan M.

description: I LOVE coming here for sushi. It's a small, cozy restaurant with super affordable sushi and alcohol. I spent 2+ hours with my friend drinking yummy hot sake and Sapporos and ordered a ton of rolls to try - all were delicious and tasted fresh. I love the ambiance here, the service, and the food.
author: Nicole P.

description: Best sushi in the city! Friendly staff that gives high quality sushi for a reasonable price. I love this place!
author: Holland M.

description:
Rest assured, the low scores here are suspect. This establishment is small, charming, efficient, and inexpensive. And the food, specifically the sushi, is excellent.

I've been coming here for nearly 20 years, and I have never once been even remotely disappointed. If you are looking for a place where Dullenials can talk about their new Samsung devices, this ain't it. If you came to eat sushi, look no further...and fancy that, it's called House of Sushi, not House of Some Pretentious Stuff My Eyebrow-Scaper Told Me About.

All of the rolls are fabulous. All of them. And all of the sashimi is fresh and delicious. The service is always friendly and competent.

Aside from the fact that it can be cramped when crowded, this is an excellent choice.
author: Joe A.

description:
My 2nd visit to "House of Sushi"

3 of us for dinner on a Friday night @ 7PM. No one at the sushi bar, and one other table occupied, shulda been an omen that we paid attention to. On the table:

- Hamachi Kama: was dry & tough, not what it should be. Seemed like it had been frozen for quite some time

- Edemame: not cooked properly (not firm, nor salted), had to ask for a salt shaker which seems to be in short supply at this joint, it took the "server" a while to locate it

- Agedashi Tofu: a poorly done rendition. Completely submersed and  soaking in the sauce, it was SOGGY. No topping at all, usually something like thinly sliced green onions or bonito (fish) flakes

- Nigiri dinner assortment: ok, thin slices of fish, some seemed to be a bit past their expiration date

- Bento box (chicken teriyaki, salad, etc.) Gets the BIZARRE dinner award for having a BLUE RUBBER BAND in the salad. Server ( owner/waitress ) responded with, "oh that must have come from the green onions" and turned and walked away... leaving the small bowl of tainted salad on the table for us to marvel at. 10 minutes later she reappears and plants a replacement salad on the table (with no BLUE RUBBER BAND), again leaving the BLUE RUBBER BAND salad on the table. 

- Various Nigiri: reported to be "ok" although this table-mate is too polite to complain

Not many customers at this prime dinner hour, so we were surprised & disappointed at the slow the service was. Good news is there was no uplift charge for the BLUE RUBBER BAND salad.

As other reviews point out, this joint is near by many Polk Street bars, and frequented by the same clientele.  Perhaps inebriation provides the necessary haze that masks the poor quality food and slow service.

For me my 2nd visit is my LAST.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Mushy sashimi and raw fish. I recommend only to get cooked rolls like the spider roll.
author: Alex Z.

description: My favorite local sushi spot! It's a fun little hole in the wall and their Crispy Spider Roll is to die for. Not only are all the rolls fantastic but they're made quick and decently priced. I am a repeat offender of getting the same roll for the past 6 months but no one will tell me differently.
author: Adrianna L.

description: Great little casual spot. The service is SO friendly and the quality of the fish is top notch. There is a bit of a wait sometimes but it's worth it for a fair price and delicious meal. Love it here!
author: Laura L.

description: This place is truly magical. The sushi is incredibly good, and the service is attentive and friendly. It's our neighborhood sushi joint and we've been going there for months. Come here if you're looking for a good meal, good atmosphere, and a good time.
author: Kevin N.

description: I used to love this place. The ambiance and the sushi were top notch and we always had a relaxing and enjoyable time when we would go. Fast forward to the last two times we went...slow service, messed up our order and forgot to bring us a roll even after we gently reminded them. I was a loyal customer and was always recommending this gem to everyone, but now, unless they hire more people and stop having the sushi chef do it all, I will not be coming back. We had to ask for our food to go today after waiting for twenty minutes or so for two rolls and having a very antsy toddler. There was only one other person at the restaurant.
author: Sasha O.

description:
I'm here in San Francisco on a vacation, my wife and I live in San Diego.
I personally have traveled a lot and I've had sushi in so many different cities and countries and I believe this place was one of the top that I ever tried.
I am really surprised that some people have given this place three and four stars instead of five, I spent the last 10 minutes reading the reviews and everyone of them said it was really good but for some reason they didn't give it a full five stars, is it because it's a small hole in the wall? But to me those happened to me the best places.
Surprisingly the price was even cheaper than what I'm used to pay and San Diego knowing that San Francisco is usually more expensive.
If you want an honest opinion, then don't judge this place by it's three stars rating, go there try it yourself and be the judge.
author: Matt K.

description:
Nice people. Great sushi. Great price. 

I always crave sushi but am never able to afford it. Found this place on a business trip and will always come back when I come to SF!
author: Jacob T.

description: I love this little place.  They have great sushi, but the rolls are especially good and such a reasonable price.  House of Sushi is always on my SFO list.  It's on an interesting street, so you can do some shopping before it opens (make sure you check the hours because it opens a bit later than I remember when I'm traveling and jet lagged).  The owner is super friendly  and makes the place extra charming.  He also makes the sushi very quickly, so you can be in and out for a show or a night on the town easily.  They also do very nice takeaway.  The rice is always fresh and you can even make special requests if there's something you don't prefer in the rolls.
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Good enough but not a destination spot.

Restaurant is tiny, maybe 10 tables. Bathroom is a single stall but clean and well appointed.

Sashimi is pretty fresh, better than the rolls. Rolls were loosely wrapped and carelessly put together. I got the dinner bento box. Filling but standard. Service was quick.

Decent spot if you live in the area.
author: Peter T.

description: Great little sushi place! Had the house salad which was with ginger salad and the Phil Roll. Yummy and filling for a great price!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a weekend for dinner and I thought it was pretty okay for Japanese food. The place is pretty cute because you can go downstairs to the restaurant. It is a cute spot but awfully hot inside. They should turn the AC on. The concept of the place is like a Japanese revolving sushi belt, but all the sushi is on little boats and the boats float on water. I did not want to eat at the bar so we sat at a table. 

FOOD: 
I ordered one of the rolls and my boyfriend got a 16pc sashimi. The sashimi was pretty good and my roll was delicious. On yelp, everyone said to try the agedashi tofu so we did and honestly, it wasn't that great. The tofu doesn't have that mochi consistency like some other places I have tried. Don't bother your time with that. I recommend a roll or some sashimi from this place.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT?
Sure, if you're looking for sashimi or rolls. Also, don't bother with the sushi belt. It looks a little gross since the water might splash on your sushi/sashimi.
author: Kelley Y.

description: Quick, tasty, authentic and inexpensive! Went here for dinner later on Friday night and found a place at the bar pretty easily. Ordering was easy, and was served very quickly. House special was amazing and everything was fresh.
author: Zack P.

description: This is our favorite neighborhood sushi spot. The food is delicious, staff is the nicest, and I love how cozy it feels inside. All the rolls we've tried have been great but our (surprising!) personal favorite is the sweet potato. This place feels authentically San Francisco and I hope it never changes. A true gem in the city!
author: Alexia B.

description:
+ great sashimi.  Yellowtail melted in my mouth 
+ fast service. In and out or leisure. You pick. 
+friendly. Super friendly sushi chef
- kamikazi sushi roll was a little less flavorful than I'd like 
+ good priced beer
++ great value.  Exactly what you want out of your neighborhood sushi joint
author: David S.

description: Best sushi restaurant in the city. Only open for dinner, but it's cheap, delicious, and a great vibe. I love this place, please don't tell the hipsters!!
author: Allen L.

description:
I don't write reviews often (as I've said before). Only when it's very well deserved (either because of excellence of extreme lack thereof). House of sushi is a case of the former - excellence on all fronts: fresh fish cut right, friendly neighborhood feel, and great value. I challenge you to find a better sushi spot in San Francisco. 

The restaurant is small and the menu basic, but every single thing is delicious. The service is outstanding. Favorites are hamachi lover roll, Oregon roll and special vegetarian roll. 

Enjoy!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Oh my god. Do not go to House of Sushi. I live around here and thought I'd try somewhere new to pick up on way home. Walked in ~6, ordered the you-choose sashimi combo (tuna, white tuna, and salmon) + the roll with salmon/avocado to-go for $30. Got home and dug in.

Roll did not taste good but I decided to finish it. I've got a stuffy nose, took a wiff and it seemed fine...whatever I just won't come back. Then the sashimi. The sashimi I legit spit back up. I took a picture. I'm worried now about getting sick. For starters the white tuna...was NOT white. Not close to white. Everything was just kindof mushy and tasted like lemony fish-mush. The salmon tasted ok but I stopped half way through thinking wait no...why am I risking it.

Gross. Russian hill needs some proper mid-level sushi.

**Update! I did not get sick, w00t. I realize review is a bit harsh maybe just a bad night for them. The people were nice, restaurant was clean and to-go service was prompt. Still was gross / still not going back. Sigh
author: Jeff B.

description:
Somehow I remember this being one of those local places where you could get a passable plate of sushi for a reasonable price.  On my recent return I was disappointed to discover it's not quite what I remember. 

Frigid service, water thin miso, stale salad and sashimi that looked like it was pulled out of one of those grocery store sushi trays.  I literally couldn't eat the salad. 

I hate to say it but I felt sorry for the sushi "chef". 

I get the feeling his days are numbered and we will soon be dealing with another dive bar full of drunk out of towners at this Polk Street address. 

That is unless he can turn things around.
author: Anthony H.

description: Close to home and really good fresh sushi... enjoy it almost once a week.. family owned great people as well as a sweet.. happy sushi chef!!
author: Renee A.

description:
FOOD:
1.) House special roll - out of all we got I liked this one, avocado and spicy crispy flakes 
2.) special Cali roll - Cali roll with Tobiko nom I like Tobiko


SERVICE
Good

ATMOSPHERE
Small casual Japanese sushi bar, hole in the wall . I like it tho, close to buncha stuff on Polk too


11.17.13
4-2016
author: Angela L.

description: It's small location but I didn't have to wait for service because they immediately took my order to go and as I waited they found me a seat and a cup of tea. Initial impression was fantastic and glad to have chosen to grab food from here.
author: Amir S.

description: Warm relaxed atmosphere, excellent customer service, well crafted rolls, and unbeatable prices. 5/5 stars!
author: Justin B.

description:
This is such a nice family restaurant where you can relax and enjoy your meal in cozy quarters. The prices are amazing and the sushi is really good too. It's old-school, small and I like that. 

If you want a fancy Marina sushi place with $15 spicy tuna rolls and a two hour wait because it's decorated in reclaimed wood, then this isn't your spot. If you want to be relaxed, full and feel like you're part of the neighborhood, this is more your style.
author: Melissa R.

description: I come here when I'm really hungry and craving for some affordable sushi LOL the fish is pretty fresh over quality is okay for the price. Definitely not a destination place but if you're in the area looking for a quick bite then come!
author: Jessie S.

description: This is definitely my favorite sushi place in SF ,the quality of fish is superior and the Japanese sushi man is very skilled and nice ,highly recommended !!
author: Fabio T.

description: I love House of Sushi! They have great food and it's not outrageously expensive like a lot of sushi places in the area. Definitely a go-to spot in the neighborhood!
author: Sarah P.

description: Came in with a group of 5, place is small but they accommodated us super fast! Service was a little slow but sushi was bomb. We got three rainbow rolls, spider roll, Phily roll, kamikaze roll and our absolute favorite- crispy chicken roll. It was gone in seconds. If you have enough room in your belly for green tea cheesecake- do it!!! It's soooo delish.
author: Jenny Q.

description: A perfect spot for a reasonably priced sushi.  Service is friendly and attentive.  The sushi is generally very good, but don't expect anything world class.  Bottom line, this is a great value in a city where even mediocre sushi is becoming obnoxiously expensive.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Amazing .....chef Katsuya is amazing!!!  If you love sashimi I highly recommend the tuna/salmon sashimi platter. If you're feeling adventurous let Katsuya pick. If you're a nigori lover like I am, I recommend the Kikusui. This is a sushi house after all, so I cannot comment on their other dishes, but the sushi was grade A++.
author: Luis C.

description: Great family run spot. Their rolls are good and you can't beat the price. Highly recommend for a cheap local sushi joint
author: Rob G.

description:
This place looked promising and inviting.  There is a large sushi bar and typical sushi bar decor.  
The service is terrible.  
In fact, it is so terrible that I left.  I was sat at a dirty table and then promptly forgotten about by the waiter, who had promised to come back with a rag to clean the table.  20 minutes later and I had to assume the waiter had quit or gone into hiding.
I have no idea how the food is bit judging by other reviews I don't think I missed anything.
author: M S.

description: The best sushi for your buck in town. I wish I would have checked out this place a long time ago since I live in the neighborhood -- but so glad my friend introduced me to it. The sashimi platter was delicious and huge (which is saying a lot bc so many places really thin out the portions). Really chill setting during the work week. I will be back!
author: Mel G.

description:
I landed there by chance
but I liked it
recommend this place with all my heart
which I have in my stomach:-)
very nice valet and great Japanese cuisine specialties
author: Tom T.

description: Good for a neighborhood sushi place. Don't expect anything special. Simple and standard sushi and entrees. The service is friendly. I go here for a quick fix for sake sashimi.
author: Kat N.

description:
Great for weeknight staple sushi - friendly staff, rarely crowded, and good fish. Won't find any next-gen sushi innovation here, but the standard maki and nigiri are both solid. 

Coming on weekend nights is more of a drag. Between the takeout orders and the dine-in folks, the one guy behind the counter is totally swamped. Plus, there are a few nearby bars that attract some obnoxious riff-raffy sake-bombers (I am occasionally that riff-raff).
author: Ryan D.

description:
Not an enjoyable experience.

Got there around 6PM, no one was in there yet ehh maybe we were just early.  Food was horrible and service was about the same.  Nice that our rice came out 10 minutes after we ordered but our main entrees still didn't come for 20 minutes after that.  Waitress asked if I would like a copy of the bill????  Seriously???  Automatic you're suppose to give me one not ask if I want one.  Then when she brought it, it wasn't even my check.  I guess that's how they scam simple folks out of money who don't ask for it, they can change the tip amount and you have no way to dispute it.

Hamachi Roll - Hamachi almost non existent in the roll
California Roll - Watery and mushy rice
Beef Teriyaki - All fat
Sashimi Dinner - 3 dinky pieces
Tonkatsu - Bland flavorless


Ended up leaving hungry and just wen to Nick's Fish tacos
author: Chris L.

description:
A simple matter of food temperature keeps me from giving House of Sushi a four star review.  I was quite happy with my late night dinner except for the fact that both my soup and rice were served warm.  This restaurant opens until 10:30 PM on Mondays thru Thursdays and later on Fridays and the weekend.

The very friendly Chinese-speaking staff greeted me and asked me to take a seat at the sushi bar.  I was pretty hungry.  I had just walked from the Moscone Center to this spot after doing a One Brick volunteer project for Under One Roof, and the only thing I had eaten in 8 hours was a crappy slice of oily pizza from North Beach Pizza at this volunteer project.  I browsed at the menu and ordered the Salmon Teriyaki dinner along with a Phoenix Roll which was posted on a specials board.

The hot tea they brought me was soothing.  The miso soup looked very good.  I expected it to be hot like my tea, but it was totally warm.  Bummer!  The soup was tasty too with lots of little tofu cubes which had settled on the bottom of the bowl, but damn it, why was it warm?!

The salmon teriyaki arrived on a big round plate with a large side of salad made up mostly of leaf lettuce.  It had just a bit of carrot and red cabbage with a tart miso-based dressing that had the significant flavor of sesame seed oil.  The salmon was grilled up beautifully slightly charred on either side; it was moist and flaky.  Us Chinese boys like our steamed rice hot, but damn it again, the bowl of rice was only warm.  Why can't these people get their food as hot as the tea?!

The Phoenix Roll combined eel, minced crab in a mayo mixture, avocado and cucumber wrapped in seaweed then rolled in soft rice and topped with shrimp and tobiko.  It was very good.  I even managed to take a very blurry photo of it that I've posted.  No, it wasn't the camera's fault.  I was just incensed that I got warm soup and rice.

As I mentioned above the restaurant staff is super friendly, and the lady must have refilled my hot tea at least three times, but sorry lady, four cups of hot tea doesn't make up for warm soup and warm rice.

The meal ended nicely with a plate of cold, juicy orange wedges.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
We went here last night randomly and was pleasantly surprised. The place was small, charming and CHEAP!

Pros: The service was friendly and attentive (the place is small), the sushi is fast and tasty (not the BEST but certainly not bad), relaxed environment.I would come back for a cheap meal and sit in the front and make sure i wont have to use the restroom. everything we ate was good! I hate hot sushi but the crunchy California roll was GOOD AND BIG!
 

Cons: I ordered plum wine and my glass was really dirty (had a vegetable stuck to the base) but the manager took it away immediately, apologized and brought me a fresh glass. I worked in the service industry so no big deal, it happens. Anyway, where i was sitting I could peek into the kitchen or dish area....looked pretty filthy lol and my boyfriend asked if they had sprite ...they said yes....he got 7up. But he drank it anyway, he isn't picky. NO BATHROOM.
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Excellent sushi. Way better than anything we have in Colorado. Move over sushi den. Psspsf!
author: Rachel L.

description: Won't be going back to this restaurant. I've been here two times and both times it was out of hunger. Both times I've gone for the bento, the batter on the tempura is heavy and thick (I prefer a light, flaky batter) and mind you, the shrimp are small. The dressing is too strong on onion which I'm not fond of. The second time I went was with my boyfriend and he found hair in his bento.....NOT GOING BACK.
author: Kim L.

description:
I think this house had too much going on! They need more helping hands!

It's a reeeaaalllly small place...it can probably seat at the most 25 people? My family and I have passed by this place before, but never been inside, so we decided to go here to celebrate my brother's birthday!
When we arrived, the host made these 2 girls who were sitting at a 4-person table move to the back! Uh..sorry? We could've waited...

Anyway, to sum the night up, the food was OK and the service was REALLY slow. It seemed like they had a lot of take-out orders and there was only one (ONE?!) sushi chef making everything! No lie, my family waited almost 45 minutes for ALL our dishes to come out. My mom's bento box came out first, we waited about 15 minutes for 2 rolls to come out, then waited another 15-20ish minutes for the last 2 rolls to come out. In between the waiting, the chef and waiters were preparing take-out boxes and even served 2 rolls to a group of guys who came in after us!
I guess it's important to get those to-go orders out since those people are waiting too, but I don't know...I guess I felt it was kind of ridiculous.

I got a Four Seasons roll (tuna, sake, albacore, & butterfish) and a Snow roll (unagi, shrimp, crab, avocado, cucumber). All the rolls seemed very hastily made and fell apart very easily. The Four Seasons was pretty tasty, but the Snow roll tasted just like a California roll.
My dad got marinated octopus, which was tasty and my mom's bento box was good too...nothing special.

Will probably not be back. Pretty expensive for the quality and service we got.
author: Kei H.

description:
After deciding that the highly rated Okoze Sushi place a few blocks away was too expensive for our budget, we ended up here looking for Japanese food. 

It was about 715, the place is small, kind of charming, and starting to get busy.

The food and sushi is incredibly cheap!! So that's a huge bonus.

We ordered the 49er roll to split - it was beyond underwhelming, in fact it barely had any flavor or taste at all.

I ordered the Eel Donburi - which was smoked BBQ in a bamboo box of white rice with some seaweed salad. I've never really had a smoked eel that tasted so smoked, it was pretty unusual but good.

My sister ordered some beef dinner plate - that came with two pieces of sashimi, a cali roll, and of course miso soup and salad. It looked a bit meh...and she said the beef was just alright. 

The green tea ice cream was very traditional and very good.

I might go back and try some other rolls if I was in the neighborhood and wanting cheap sushi.
author: Chloé M.

description: Definitely get the house and the kamikaze rolls. On point. The service is alright, family owned and the waitress seems like the daughter who doesn't want to work. I give her props for sucking through it though. The chef is very sweet. The cuts of fish seem fresh, much fresher than North Beach Sushi if that's a comparison. I thoroughly enjoyed it. I hope you do as well!
author: Elisabeth H.

description:
Golden birthdays and rolls.

Bad plan: Not taking the first bus out of the Marina after the fireworks for the Golden Gate Bridge's 75th birthday. Took almost three hours to get home.

Better plan: Dinner at House Of Sushi while waiting. Ordered the Golden Gate roll (salmon skin and veggies) and chicken teriyaki roll. Six large pieces each. Twelve very good bites all together.

Twelve bucks included tip for the friendly and attentive service. Fair to me.

Bridge will always beat the roll. Roll ended up being perfect after the bridge.
author: Jason B.

description:
Sushi? Decent
Service? So-so
Ambiance? small and cramped
Specials? Pretty decent
Bathroom? Like the bar's

Overall, this is a decent place for sushi, their rolls are decent.

This place is a-ok to me as nothing was standing out as spectacular.
author: Eva Y.

description:
This is my second trip to House of Sushi.  The first visit I gave them a pass, assuming it was a bad visit.  This time,  the service was abominable. 
Walking in, I point to an empty chair at the sushi bar and ask "Can I sit here?"  The waiter shakes his head no, goes to the end of the bar - right next to the kitchen and dishwashing station - removes a coat from the chair that obviously belongs to someone that works there - and tells me to sit there.  Why did he have to seat me away from everyone else, and far away from the sushi chef?
The sushi chef comes down and asks what I want.  That was the last time anyone spoke to me!  The sushi came - Salmon and Hamachi Nigiri, and a rainbow roll.  The sushi is mediocre, with little flavor.
Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.
author: Randy W.

description:
I like this place. It's not terrible, but it's also not the most amazing place I've ever been to. 

The service is wishy-washy, but it's quiet and small enough to truly be considered intimate. 

The location is close enough to my apartment that even when I'm THAT lazy, I could still walk here and be home in less time than it would take to complain about the walking distance. 

All in all, it's average and the price is good for my poor budget, so I'd come here as my go-to sushi spot. 

Also, they have five dollar large sakes....NOW you understand.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Came here on Saturday with my friends before we ventured out to experience Santacon. The food was good, but they were very stingy with their portions and the service was pretty slow for an empty restaurant. Being the Japanese food fan that I am, it's safe to say that this is not my go to restaurant.

It's a cute place that's very understaffed and somewhat slow. I'm not sure how it is on a busy night, but I definitely wasn't impressed for the price I paid. It could have been a lot better for something on Polk Street. Consider another place if you want good sushi for a decent price.
author: Michael N.

description: Perfect spot for when you're craving sushi but do not want to pay prices of other nearby sushi spots. Small restaurant but staff is friendly!
author: Rachel M.

description:
What a pleasant surprise! Hungry for sushi on a Sunday night, my wife and I stumbled across this place and really enjoyed ourselves. We sat at the bar as all the tables were filled, and got to see the chef making the rolls, which is always fun. He was also very nice, as was the rest of the staff. On that note, service wasn't noticeably slow, as I've seen several reviews mention, though I imagine if the place were slammed, things could get dicey. 

We started our meal off with two Miso soups, which were hot and delicious, with nice thick pieces of seaweed included. Then the rolls began to come out. All of them were very good, though I think the 'Crunch Roll' might have been our top pick in terms of both taste and value.

Ooh, that reminds me - pricing needs a mention. While the special rolls will run you the standard painful sushi prices of around $12, the regular menu items are all very reasonably priced and quite tasty. We tried a large sampling to get an idea of the place, but we could have easily taken a roll or two off and had a filling meal.

House of Sushi isn't blazing any new trails in terms of sushi, but they make a variety of rolls very well, most of them for decent prices. If you're in the area and craving some tasty seaweed-wrapped snacks, then by all means, make the time to stop on by!
author: Matthew L.

description:
We walk in for a to go order and they tell us it will be 15 minutes. My girlfriend and I walk across the street and browse around at real foods while waiting, we get back 15 minutes later and they haven't even started making our order!  

To appease us they bring out our miso and cucumber salad but it takes so long to make our order that the soup is cold by the time everything is done. We tell them we want hot miso and they guy says I hot it up....ok fresh sounded better but I guess we will have to settle for reheated.

Once we finally got the food it was pretty good.  We got two sashimi plates that were surprisingly cheap and came with 12 big pieces of sashimi. The chef kept it pretty run of the mill giving us ahi, mugaro, hamachi and sake. Everything was pretty tasty and no bad pieces, but no melt in your mouth pieces either.

The rolls were decent, the toro in the spicy toro roll was a little tough though. 

Besides the way longer than quoted wait this place was pretty decent. Pricing isn't too bad either.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Warning: I don't eat rolls. Ever.

Probably the most under-rated nigiri/sashimi joint in Nob Hill. I don't think this restaurant is Japanese owned, but the chef is Japanese. Just ask what's fresh, he won't lie. 

The salmon and yellowtail were super yummy. The baby octopus sashimi was delish. Uni from Santa Barbara (need I say more?). Never-frozen amaebi (this is rare). Ankimo prepped right. Natto handroll to finish up. The nori was fresh and toasted perfectly.

This place isn't fancy but I've tried everything in this area and this is by far the best. If they carried chutoro or otoro and had a better beer selection then I could give 5 stars.
author: Grayson K.

description:
This is my favorite local sushi joint. The ownership is phenomenal and it's been the same guy slingin' sushi ever since I moved here two years ago. I always seem to get the spicy tuna and the spider roll. They both are consistently awesome and filling. 

More recently I started getting the seaweed salad which is cold, refreshing, and topped with sesame seeds. If I don't have anyone to eat with this is also a great spot to kick it at their sushi bar, put in the headphones, and read a book. Very relaxing.

On the flip side if you do have a small group, want quick, cheap sushi and saki this is the place to be!
author: Jason M.

description:
I've been going to this place for about 15 years and I've never had a bad meal.  Particular standouts for me are the Dragon Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll, Hamachi Lover Roll, and the Spider Roll.  Dessert (Unagi!) is also quite tasty.  The prices are good for the neighborhood and you get generous cuts of fish.

The restaurant is relatively small and gets really busy as the evening progresses, so it's nice to get there early and sit at the bar and chat with the chef when he's not super busy.

I keep telling myself to try somewhere else in the neighborhood, but after all these years I keep returning to my House of Sushi.  If you're in the neighborhood, you should definitely give it a try and you won't be disappointed.
author: Kimberly B.

description: If I had seen the reviews I may not have come here, I am glad I didn't. The food is amazing, the prices are great, the chef seems to be an awesome person. The Hana roll and hamachi lover roll is amazing.
author: Avishaan S.

description: Went here after a few drinks and was extremely impressed with the food and service here. I've had many different qualities of sushi, miso, and edemame and this is right up there towards the top, I will definitely be working this into my weekly routine.
author: Chris M.

description: A favorite neighborhood spot; the dragon roll is our favorite. Creamy, saucy, crunchy and lots of umami! There is one sushi chef and they are all very friendly here. Rolls are a good size and fairly inexpensive. A great go to for dinner when you don't want to over do it but you want to enjoy your meal.
author: Jolie N.

description: I love this place and probably go here once a week at least. My favorite roll is the 49er roll and routinely get the Hamachi and Sake nigiri. This is a great spot for getting sushi that is not too expensive and never do you fear being judged for how you eat the sushi under the watchful eye of the chef. Elephant Sushi may get all of the acclaim (which is well deserved; it's phenomenal) but I find myself coming here much more often for good prices and friendly people. Take out is always an easy option as well.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Great sushi and rolls, great service, very reasonable prices and given we live just up the street; great location.

The guy who makes the sushi is so friendly and knows us now so sometimes gives us extra bits and pieces to try, or free edamame if we don't order starters. We already love it here, but it's also nice to be treated well as loyal customers.

Consistently tasty; the dragon roll, hanna roll and volcano roll before ordering pretty much all the sushi choices
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I was headed for Tonic bar after a long day at work, sans dinner. However, I knew drinking on an empty stomach would lead me to expunge pricy beverages all over the sidewalk. This was not the type of holiday spirit(s) I wanted to spread. 

A few blocks before Tonic, I spied House of Sushi. It didn't look like much inside but I just needed something to eat. I popped in and asked the chef what their specials were. The chef simply pointed at the wall to a bunch of rolls. So much for customer service. 

I ordered a house roll and sake nigiri to start http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/iKJezaKMdA9uASaFBMq1aA/l I could have picked up similar quality from a supermarket. So I decided to give them a second change to redeem themselves and ordered the spicy scallop. It's hard to mess this roll up and I grade on the amount of kewpie and sriracha used http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/zFGCg_zXyq56mfUyEzo5bA/l A little bit too much mayo for my taste, not enough sriracha, and more importantly, it was not rolled tightly and promptly fell apart when I grabbed it with my chopsticks. More on this later. 

I wasn't expecting much and didn't get much. But House of Sushi did its job and helped me conquer the night with a full stomach and better tolerance. 

P.S. On a side note, the waitress kept staring at me. I thought she was jocking me, but when I got outside, I noticed I had kewpie on my nose. 

DOH.
author: Jason C.

description: I've been going to House of Sushi for the past 5 years. It's really one of the few great sushi places on the street. It won't be as crowded as okoze and puzzle. You have to know what to order here. The owner is very nice and great to talk to. I highly recommend the House Salad, Boston Roll, Unagi Unadon, sake sashimi and Sweet Potato roll. That's good enough for 2, we paid $46. They also have great oysters. Friendly service, quick and reasonably priced. I enjoy this place and will certainly return.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Love this place. Sushi chef is great, service is fast. Always something new on the menu as well! Love having nigiri and beers at the sushi bar!
author: Jon B.

description: Sure it isn't the best sushi in San Francisco, but for anyone living in the area it is a quick and easy alternative to the more pricier and fancier sushi places in the area. I agree with most positive reviews -- consistent taste, friendly and reasonably priced.
author: Sarah Z.

description: This is our go to sushi place, even though we live much closer to japan town. We love how they keep to the basics and not over complicate their rolls. By far our favorites are the dragon roll and the alaska roll. Pure and simple. I also love the hand rolls, which they can make from any fish (even if it is not on the menu). Service is friendly, especially the sushi chef. And usually they can squeeze us in even in rush hour.
author: Lajos M.

description:
The sushi was good, the waitresses were SLOW, and the place was a bit packed. Expect to wait a bit if you want to sit at the bar. The fellow who makes the sushi is actually Japanese, good at what he does, and very friendly. The wasabi was good, but not excellent. The fish was flavorful, but not the best I've ever had.

Overall, it was a good experience, though I spent more than I'd intended. I think I might come back with friends, or order out since it's close to where I'm staying.
author: Chris S.

description:
the staff is nice and friendly. the food is great and fresh. 
they always have specials posted up on a dry erase board that changes all the time so if you go here you must check out the specials.
the prices are fair and the service is quick.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
Yet another place I'd probably give 3 stars but boosted it up for VALUE and SERVICE.

Note, if you want the review on raw fish, I can only give it from my friends viewpoints.  I have eaten the cooked food here and it's pretty good.  It's nothing to write home about but it's enjoyable, fast and affordable.  I should note that my friend lives across the street so walking in to House of Sushi is like walking into his living room, and they are extremely friendly to us.  I have had their udon, teriyaki stuff, california rolls, chicken teriyaki roll, gyoza and have enjoyed them all.  For what you pay, it's well worth it.  If you're looking for gourmet Japanese food, then this isn't your stop.  But then again, Russian Hill is just the wrong neighborhood to be searching for real washoku!
author: Traci H.

description:
There's only one order that I liked about this restaurant.  The albacore white tuna.  It just melt in your mouth.  All else was not that good.

Spicy tuna roll.............below average/ too simple/ tastless
house roll..............again not too innovative
ankimo...................fresh.......very good
jumbo shrimp tempura.......not that good, overly battered, shrimps aren't jumbo
california roll......didn't do it for me
agadashi tofu........it just fell apart

Chef gave us complimentary mussels with ponsu/hot sauce and tobiko.

49.00

There are better places but this place has this cozy feel to it and they were nice.
author: jason g.

description: Very typical, run-of-the-mill sushi restaurants on Polk right next to all the bars. Full of drunk people that go there for some fillers and not so much quality, sophisticated Japanese foods. they have a good selection of menu items but nothing spectacular or unique. The restaurant itself is a little old too but people do not come here expecting Morimoto.
author: Ed L.

description: Stopped in here for a bite to eat on a whim and was pleasantly surprised with the food. Although the ambiance is nothing fancy, the food was good and so affordable. I think the miso soup was $1.75 and along with edamame, three rolls, and a bottle of sake, the bill was just barely $40. We had a spicy tuna roll along with a yellowtail roll and both were topped with very sizable and meaty chunks of fresh fish. If we are strolling down Polk and in the mood for sushi there's no reason we wouldn't return.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Sushi rolls are yummy! I got the Godzira Roll, Spider Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll with some green tea. The Service was great. I would come here again.
author: Chanel B.

description:
Good place to go if you're indecisive about what you want to order and want to try a little of everything. They have lots of bento options. However, it's pretty overpriced for the quality you get -- the food is not that amazing. After I finished my $20 (after tax and tip) meal, I was still hungry. One of my friends only ordered some sashimi and a bowl of rice and that came out to $14 for her.

Oh yeah, the restaurant was pretty empty, except for the table of 4 guys behind us. Their conversation kept us pretty amused. One of them had recently dumped his "hot, Russian girlfriend" because he caught her looking through his stuff...
author: Jessica W.

description: I have really enjoyed my rolls each time I go here. The thing I hate most is when am served this dainty little roll at sushi houses. House of Sushi on Polk/Vallejo is fresh, chilled and substantially portioned. I will continue to patronize this place and highly encourage you to try for yourselves. Cheers.
author: Ryan B.

description: So, I was going to give a one-star but then the sushi was halfway decent. I literally waited for a single roll for 30 minutes while the chef made order after order for takeout. I almost walked out. When I got the roll, it was better than average which was minorly redeeming. Sigh.
author: Rachel M.

description: We were visiting from out of town for a few weeks in the Russian Hill  area and found this great,  small  & cozy little place.  It has delicious grilled Hamachi Kama and Green Mussels.  Went back three times during our stay and will miss it. The owners, chef and service were very  friendly and accommodating and  we were warmly greeted on each return.  Thank you for the plum wine treat House of Sushi!!  Will definitely return here if we come back to this area. Already missing the grilled Hamachi Kama.
author: Celeste M.

description: Wow, what a bargain! Big slices of fish on your roll and it doesn't break the bank....even with a bottle of sake!
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Quick, fresh, fun & reasonably priced. A great place to start your night on Polk St.

I've always had a good experience here, I'm not understanding the bad reviews. 

We always get:
+Spider roll
+Spicy tuna roll
+Sushi combination (substituting the crab for tuna)
+Assorted sushi - the butterfish is usually excellent
author: Sara P.

description: I love House of Sushi!  I go here a couple times a week.  It is good food at such a great price.  It has a wonderful, cozy neighborhood feel.  The waitress is always happy and sweet. Get the Boston Roll and the Oregon roll.
author: Christine M.

description: I've gone to this place a couple times when I just want something fast and cheap to take home for dinner.  The prices are really good, and they have good dinner box specials.  It's not somewhere I'd actually go out to eat though.  There are also places that are pretty comparable in price that have sushi that is tastier in the area.  I would go back though since I live so close by.
author: Annette E.

description:
I'm not sure why House of Sushi has such bad reviews. The place is small, very small, but the staff was polite and the food was delicious. It's casual, not pretentious, inexpensive, and clean. Really, a great neighborhood Sushi place, when you're in the mood for something simple, fresh and easy.

We ordered the Salmon, Hamachi and Crispy Spider roll, all very tasty.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description:
Such a SF treasure! A hole in the wall place that is easily overlooked, but should not be.

Great prices. I brought my mother here when she came to visit. We each ordered 3 different rolls and LOTS of warm sake. It was the perfect hideaway on such a cold night.

I recommend the Spicy Tuna and Spicy Scallop Roll... my Mom also really liked the Salmon Roll she got.

Great sushi does not need to be super pricey, contrary to the popular correlation. This place is my new favorite sushi joint. And the proximity to my flat could not be better!
author: Amanda H.

description:
I use to come here almost every other week a few years ago and stopped since i moved out of the city. Now that i'm back , I visited House of Sushi and was pretty disappointed. The sushi didnt seem as fresh as it use to be years ago and it just didnt hit "the spot". We were seated in a little corner and our food took forever. I also had to get up to get their attention a few times. 
My bf says we're never coming back..What a bummer :(
author: M W.

description:
There were four of us looking for a place to eat late on a Sunday night.  We decided to try Polk Street and saw House of Sushi. I looked at the menu outside, which said that they were open till 11pm on Sunday. As it was only 10:15pm, I thought this would be perfect. We enter the restaurant, which was empty, and the guy behind the sushi counter scowls at us and says, "Takeout only!" 

We thought about it for a while, and figured we would do takeout and just eat at my place. While we're perusing the menus, my first friend tells the server what he wants. The server then walks away without asking what anyone else wants. Five minutes later, he walks back into the room so I run up to him before he can leave again and place my order. Again, he leaves before my other 2 friends can place their orders. My other 2 friends at this point give up trying to order and we leave. 

The food? I ordered a green salad, california roll, and philadelphia roll. All pretty basic. The green salad was just lettuce and shredded cabbage       . The rolls were okay, though the rice was a little hard. 

At least the prices were reasonable, so I don't feel like I wasted too much money. I guess you get what you pay for...
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I think people have 2 sushi moods. People either want designer sushi, with nuts and chicken and cream cheese and other weird, not authentic food items rolled up in rice and seaweed sleeping bags. I get it. There's a time and place for that. But House of Sushi is not for that time, and it is not that place. It's for the other sushi mood, the one where you just want the fish and the rice and the occasional avocado chunk. And House of Sushi suits this mood well.

There are specialty rolls, but they're not their specialty. (I hope I used all three of those correctly! Homonyms FTW.) You're better off with the basics here, i.e. the Spicy Tuna, the Alaska, the Spider, that sort of thing. They do it consistently well, the prices are consistently low, and the people who work here are consistently courteous. House of Sushi is a great go-to sushi spot on Polk Street. 'Nuff said.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
I came in for dinner out of convenience. Being new to the Polk Street area, I am trying to find my go-to spots for dinner that aren't too expensive. I really wanted to like House of Sushi. 

First the place smelled fishy when we walked in.  It was a Saturday at 8pm and no one was eating either, which should have been a sign. We both enjoyed the gyoza, it came out hot and well made. Three of the four rolls we thought were okay, the other one was so fishy we couldn't eat it. 

Overall we spent about $50 with sake too and left feeling like that was pretty pricey for what we got. Most people came in for take-out so maybe in the future we would do that since it is so close to home.
author: Natalie N.

description:
This place serves really good sushi at really reasonable prices, in a very cool neighbourhood (mine, better known as Polk Street), and the owner always greets you with a HUGE, genuine smile from behind his little sushi counter thingy.  If you're a regular, he remembers you, but even before I became a regular, the service was always very friendly and timely.  Actually, I love this place so much that I have taken almost all of my out of town guests here and they have loved it.

My favourite is the crispy spider roll, followed by the house roll.  Other favourites include the spicy tuna roll, the Philadelphia roll, and the 49er roll.  Also, the yellowfin jaw is a very tasty and different appetizer.  The shumai and gyoza both have pork and while very tasty, are not groundbreaking must-haves.

Although the place is really small, I've managed to seat groups of up to 6.
author: Dmytro A.

description: Inexpensive sushi that actually tastes good!  The hot food is mediocre but the sushi is fairly fresh and decent.  Servers are friendly and the storefront is cozy.  A little gem particularly for weeknights out!
author: Victor S.

description: I wish it was possible to give less than one star.  I went in to place a to go order and ordered a California Roll minus the crab ($4.00).  I was then charged $5.50.  I showed him the item on the menu and asked why it would be more, when I only wanted 2/3 of the ingredients listed (I didn't expect it to be cheaper, but I certainly didn't expect a $1.50 up charge).  He got extremely flustered and started rambling.. then told me I could just take my money.  No comment on the sushi since I walked out without it, but based on the awful customer service and unappealing look of my to-go order...I'd say I didn't miss out.
author: Jake H.

description:
We went here last night around 9:45pm and were really pleased. There were a handful of customers, some at tables, some at the bar. We grabbed 2 seats at the bar and were immediately addressed by the sushi chef. We told him what we wanted to drink since the waiter hadn't had a chance to come by yet and the waiter brought over our drinks a few minutes later. We ordered the White Hana Roll and the Hamachi Lovers roll at first. Both were really fresh and delicious. After we wanted something else as well so we ordered a Spider Roll and a Golden Gate Roll (salmon skin). Those were both delicious as well. They seem to specialize in rolls, so we mostly stuck with that. My husband ordered some Salmon Roe Nigiri and reported it to be "sooo good." 

Overall - fresh fish, friendly service (not the fastest, but not slow either), open late - great for a late weeknight neighborhood sushi fix!
author: Emily C.

description:
Good prices for good sushi!

I love sushi house in Russian Hill.  It is not too busy and it has a good selection of sushi.  My favorite roll is the Godzi(ll)/(r)a roll that comes out deep fried and dripping in sauce.  It is the most expensive roll on the menu at around $11 but it is very awesome.  My other favorite its the house special roll which is very very reasonably priced and is a staple of my orders.

The sake comes in a pretty unique serving vessel that has a big old ice cube in the middle to keep it cool the entire time you are sipping it.  Pretty nice!  The hot team comes in very cute cups too!

I have not had the negative service experiences that many of the other reviewers are complaining about.
author: Matthew F.

description:
This place is depressing. The chef hates his job, has a bad attitude, and is a sad person to be around. On top of that, the music will set you in a somber mood. I honestly try to stop by here to help them out a little but the experience is always so pathetic that I'm throwing in the towel. the service is poor and have a tendency to be rude and not acknowledge you until you speak to them.

Head to Wasabi and Ginger for better ambience, food and overall experience.
author: Lady L.

description: Definitely one of the better sushi places in the area. I enjoyed some miso soup, gyozas, and hamachi nigri here. This place is pretty cheap for the quality in my opinion. I think I ended up spending about 12 bucks for my entire meal... not bad at all. The staff was friendly and welcoming, and there were plenty of places to sit and eat when I walked in around 7pm on a weeknight. I'll be back!
author: Ashley D.

description:
Service sucks, and I am not basing this on one review..but three visits.
Sushi is what  I am talking about ....Nigiri or for those of you that understand nihongo,  . 
 For you idiots that think rolls are sushi, you should be banned from posting your reviews.
In regards to the quality of the sushi,it is  is below par.
author: Kenn P.

description:
We are neighbors and have been coming here for 7 years.  Service is excellent - we only eat at the sushi bar where our sushi man works - he is fantastic - friendly, warm, caring and inviting.   The sushi is always very good - you will not find edgy roll combinations here, nor will you find many misses.  The house roll and kamakazi rolls at $5.75 each are excellent, loaded with fish and impossible to beat for the price.

Ambiance is friendly and warm, and without the "sushi scene" or attitude that comes with so many trendy places.   If you want drinking and a scene, probably not your spot.  But if you want great sushi in a friendly chill environment and not have to wait, this is your place.
author: michael d.

description: I live right down the street from this gem and frequently stop by for sushi to go for dinner.  The sashimi is always fresh and the waitress is always friendly and ready to take my takeout order. I was also offered complimentary hot tea while I waited to take my food.  I came here for a sit-in dinner once and had a great meal.  Highly recommended.  Prices are very reasonable.
author: Marin G.

description: Very reasonable prices for tasty sushi.  They always answer the phone and my order is ready in ten minutes.
author: Poppy C.

description: Best, healthy late night option.  Great, friendly service.  Reasonably priced.
author: Desiree G.

description:
Fish was too cold and almost tasted like it had just been defrosted.

Quality of the fish wasn't very good.

They did not bring us water.

The rice in the Nigiri seemed a little undercooked and was dry.

Overpriced for the quality.

Overall not very good sushi and I would not recommend. But a positive for being open at 10pm on a Thursday!
author: Elaine S.

description: Special crispy spider roll is a rip at 12 bucks. The crab tampura is heavy in batter and comes with teryaki sauce which is interesting. The california roll doesn't use real crab and is heavy with mayo. Sushi is untraditional and ingredients are fair. Not a place if ur looking for an experience. Just a place to get you by while you find another better sushi place for the buck.
author: Wayne T.

description: Came here for dinner with a couple of friends that thought it was very under-rated.  Decent service, decent prices, and really great rolls.  I thought the rainbow, white tuna, and dragon rolls here were very excellent.    We didn't really order anything else so I'm not able to comment.... but the rolls we had were pretty terrific.
author: Michael C.

description:
I probably wouldn't go out of my way for this place but I live on Polk so it's an easy Sushi fix that pretty much does the trick. 

I must admit I'm not much of an adventerous sushi eater as I stick to California rolls, spicy tuna rolls and then vegetarian options like the tempura yam roll. Overall the edamame tend to be a little overcooked and mushy but the rolls are decent. However, we ordered some variation of a California roll the last time I was there thinking it would have tempura in it but were sadly mistaken as it had mayo in it. Who wants mayo in sushi? yuk. 

Overall though - I'll be back for simple sushi without very high expectations. If you feel like walking a little further, I'd reccomend Wasabi & Ginger.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
I'm probably the most lenient sushi reviewer to every exist on Yelp. To be honest, I have no idea what constitutes a "good" roll. I could tell you whether I ate a fantastic pizza or burrito but sushi is just way over my head. I just know whether or not I like to keep eating it and generally, I always do. Which may or may not be a testament to my inner fat girl, but I won't go there (my belt is feeling particularly tight today and it's making me depressed). House of Sushi was no different in this respect. I liked it so I ate...gobble gobble. 

One whole extra star goes for the rare and wonderful company I had. He was by far the highlight of my evening. :)
author: Julia N.

description: The food is here is solid and the prices are reasonable. The sushi may not be the highest quality sushi in the world, but it's reasonable for the price.
author: Scoot S.

description:
I had a good experience at House of Sushi the other night, contrary to many of the other reviews.

The sushi chef was friendly and fun, fish was super fresh and they served us after midnight...

It wasn't cheap, but what good sushi is?
author: Jason R.

description: Quite possibly the worst sushi I have ever experienced. Nigiri portion was huge but was tasteless. California roll fell out of the seaweed it was so badly made. Unagi was full of bones. Sloppy work.
author: mathieu i.

description:
100% Chinese.
There are 2 Sushi chefs, a dark skin thin guy and a light skin flat face guy.
Usually dark skin guy does sushi and light skin guy in the kitchen. sometimes they switch. When the light skin guy doing Sushi, I don't know.

But I think I finally figured out what's going on about Sushi in SF.
It's like baseball in Japan.
Baseball in Japan is totally different ball game, even though strike zone is different over there.
Many American major league players really have a hard time playing in Japan because of it.
Japanese umpire calls strike that it should be called "ball" in America.
How can it be so different?
I thought strike is strike, ball is ball.
I thought strike zone is universal rule.
Well, it seems like Japanese strike is different than American strike.

We got the dark skin guy was doing our sushi,
He might be Japanese, I don't know, I don't care. 

We had 2 order of each Nigiri :
Maguro, $3.75 x 2
Hamachi, 3.75 x 2
Katsuo, 3.75 x 2
Tai, 3.75 x 2
and,
1 Jive Ass Roll called "Kirin Roll" avocado, cucumber, deep fried soft chell crab and Spicy-Mayo sauce shit on it.= $12
You heard me right,
FXXX Yeah!  Nobu K. had a JIVE ASS ROLL on Polk Street !!!!
What the Hell?
The reason why I ordered because all specials on the board were all Jive Ass Rolls!
I was looking for some today's special fish but there was None.

Orion Beer, Great Okinawan Beer! I love this beer. Large $7 x 2

+ tax = 60 bucks!
Very reasonable sushi for 2.

This place was very busy the night.

I must say It wasn't too bad.
I liked his Nigiri style.
His Nigiri  were all nicely balanced between Shari(Sushi rice) and Neta(raw fish).
His Shari(Sushi rice) was actually good size. It wasn't too small. Bigger than most Pseudo Sushi places.
But, missing something, there was a lack of ........

It's a kind of different strike zone.

But there were few issues.
I really didn't enjoy watching the Sushi chef was keep coughing very often. He was very polite nice guy and everything but the coughing wasn't too attractive especially dealing with RAW FISH!
It was bothering us so badly because we sat the counter, he was right front of us!
WHAT THE FXXX MATTER WITH YOU?
At least COVER YOUR FXXXIN' MOUTH, YOU DUMB ASS!!!!!!!
 
There was NO Agari, Agari is a nice cup of hot tea in the end of Sushi.
I have to have Agari when I finish Sushi meal.

And, they gave me slices of orange in the end.
I don't mind eating slices of orange after I had a Beef Chow mein and Mongolian beef over rice.
But I don't think it'll match slices of orange and raw fish in my stomach.
Urrrrrrrrrrr!
I got goose bumps when I saw the slices of orange.

The bottom line is, Cover your mouth when you cough. Please!

Nigiri style, 3.5 it was pretty good actually. Not too bad. a lot better than the Live Sushi Bar for sure.
Fish, 3 It was definitely cheap fish.
Rice, 3 sweet side.
Jive Ass Roll, 5, I don't really know how to judge, taste all same to me.
Service, 4
Price, 4, Cheap fish= Cheap price.
The other Sushi Chef, light skin fat face guy's sushi, 1

I really wanted give 3 but cough without covering his mouth right in the sushi counter? out of question.

Jessica L. said, " The bathroom in this place is the most frightening thing I have ever been in. EWWWWWWWWW!!!!"

Yeah, their bathroom & kitchen are FRIGGIN DISGUSTING!!!
author: Nobu K.

description:
SERVICE = The service is a bit slow.  Also, once I ordered it to go and I was waiting for such a loooOOng time even though I had ordered over the phone allowing enough time between the call and pick-up.

SUSHI =  Oh my wasabi!  I've definitely had better rolls elsewhere.  I don't really know where to begin because I don't really want to remember it.  

PAYMENT/PRICING =  I'd have to say that it's overpriced for the quality.  Now, if they had cheaper pricing, you'd understand why you were getting what they offered.

PARKING = Street parking.. just like the other restaurants/establishments in the area--it sucks during peak times.

*EXPERIENCE* = Oh House of Sushi how I wish you were better in so many ways.. especially with your sushi rolls.  The ambiance needs help, too.. feels a bit unclean.  The feeling I get is that there's no love.. management and employees must have no love for this place?  Well, there's definitely no love from this yelper.. I just didn't have the heart to give it one star because at least I was able to get food and service.  Unless management has already changed or improved, this place definitely needs help.
author: Doreen M.

description:
koreans and japanese use sweet short grain or calrose rice which is usually bit more sticky....but at house of sushi the rice seemed a bit dry and hard to eat with a chopstick....not a good sign already....

teriyaki chicken and teriyaki salmon...(after looking at the prices..i decided to order cooked items)....bit too charred and dry...a side of teriyaki sauce might have made it better in masking the charred taste...

fried tempura...bit over battered....but it was cooked okay....tempura sauce was light and done right....

the rolls...hmm..we stuck with mostly california rolls...how can anybody possibly go wrong with california rolls....it was okay....i would have given it 2 stars...but urgh...i was feeling so ill after my meal...i was thinking it was all the beers i drank before i ate...but after seeing all the 1 star reviews..i'm guessing it might have been the food...they do deliver though..
author: Hen A.

description:
A great find while wandering around Polk

A small restaurant but plenty of counter space and the intimate setting helps ensure you won't get lost by the waitstaff.

The miso soup was delicious and fresh tasting.  Had an Oshinko, picked radish seaweed roll, to start and then chicken teryaki and sushi combo.  The sushi were chef's choice and I received Maguro and Amaebi along with some standard California Roll.  

Definately a place to seek out next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: Lester R.

description:
I was walking the streets of San Francisco traveling in circles, alone; it was after dark....hadn't slept in days. Coughing blood....eyes bloodshot and crazed. 

Heroine? 

No worse.

But, suddenly....I felt a purpose again. I felt I needed to get to House of Sushi for sustenance.  

I thought I was close, but woke up in my lonely bed in a cold sweat. 

Eventually I did make it to House of Sushi. The albacore was as smooth and buttery as ever. The green tea and the Japanese characters on the ceramic mug  containing it spoke comforting stories that I couldn't quite understand but knew meant everything was going to be ok.

House of Sushi is not even close to the finest sushi restaurant in the city or the most innovative. But as standard as the atmosphere, the menu items, and presentation of the food is, the fish always comes out perfect. 

It's a low maintenance place; the kind of establishment you want to be a regular in, with friendly staff that don't try to put on a show, but give you just the right amount of attention to make sure you are comfortable.
author: Joel P.

description: I was pretty hammered so don't remember specifics only that it was really good. Drinking a few doors down and started to get hungry,   I asked the bartender for a suggestion and she didn't disappoint. The fish at HoS was fresh and the service and knowledge from the sushi Chef was top notch. The salmon was probably the freshest I've ever had and the rolls were awesome.
author: Bif P.

description:
It is interesting reading the reviews. You either love or hate this place. As you can see we loooove it. The more you come and know the people the better service and food you get. Literally, we go there so often that they have become part of our family. 

The food is outstanding, the fish is extremely fresh. We wouldn't order sashimi anywhere else. I'm always craving it again days after. I think at this point, I'm seriously addicted to sushi. 

You can't judge a sushi place on how together a roll stays or how nice the place is. I agree, it is small and sometimes even too crowded. But we go there to eat good, fresh, healthy  fish, good portions and friendly service.  

What else can you ask for?
author: Nicole K.

description:
Came here after my boxing workout at around 9:45pm on a Wednesday.  I'd been here before, but it's been a while.  Plus, I didn't want to have anything heavy.

It's a nice place with some nice decoration.  I sat down at the bar and noticed that the candle holders were a bit messy.  Like someone had drank out of them.  Also, they didn't have any sodium-lite soy sauce in sight either.  I was going to ask for it, but I just wasn't in the mood to ask for it.

The food I thought was pretty good.  I always order a Philly roll to use as a benchmark.  It was very tasty, but not so tasty that it didn't need a bit of soy sauce.  Pricing is tough...  A wee bit higher than I thought would be good, but just barely.  I paid $15 for Philly and Spicy Toro roll and Miso soup..  Not bad.   got the food pretty quickly too.

Staff was attentitive, but not as friendly as I've experienced at other sushi restaurants.  But they kept asking me how things were...  So that's nice.

A great neighborhood place and definitely someplace to bring someone to have a nice meal and talk.  Borderline romantic too!
author: R G.

description: After a failed excursion for German food the BF and I ended up here. Honestly, the sushi is pretty good. I got the salmon teriyaki and sashimi (4 pieces of tuna) dinner combination while he had two rolls. We split the potato pancakes (which is basically a pressed croquette). All in all, it was good, the staff was friendly and the service was good.
author: Shauna S.

description:
This place gave everyone else a stomach and made me feel fat.  so stay away....

I think its funny though because they deliver in a "limited area."  By "limited area" it means within walking distance.  AAAAAAAAAAAHAHAHAHAH.  My food was walked to me.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Not bad, solidly above average food. The sushi rice is a little sticky, the waiter forgot one of my rolls, and the service was pretty slow despite us being the only ones there for about 15 minutes. 

But it feels like a friendly enough place, and as a neighborhood sushi place goes, the rolls were tasty and fresh. 

If I go back I will probably just sit at the bar and order from the chef, however.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I've gone to this place several times since being introduced by a friend.  While reviews I read in the months before gave me some pause I was pleasantly surprised by the hospitality of the chef and quality of the sushi.  Have had a fair selection of shashimi and rolls....super good deal for the money!  You know how everybody seems to have "this little sushi place I love" this is a classic example of that.  Not too fussy or high priced.  I recommend sitting at the bar so you can interact with the chef and see how much skill goes in to each dish!
author: Peter W.

description:
First off, the prices are a tad more than what I've seen at nearby sushi joints. And the place is pretty small but that's the norm on that part of Polk Street.

The Godzilla roll is awesome this is pretty much what makes me want to return to the House of Sushi over and over again. 

Not so minor nitpick, their order pickup customer service is really lacking and causes me to take away one star. When a person arrives to pickup an order called in almost an hour prior, just admit that you are late in preparing it rather than leaving her twiddling her thumbs wondering what's going on.

Other than that this place is worth a visit at least once, just don't order for pickup.
author: Jen A.

description: Good sushi and a fair price.  Sit at the table next to the window and watch the world go by as I gorge on sushi.
author: Mark W.

description:
We popped in here during the week and had the front table by the window. As we were the only people in the restaurant, the service was prompt, polite, and very fast. He was able to elaborate on all the dishes we asked about, not to mention offer some quality advice on house specials. The meal was very enjoyable and affordable. 

I will definitely go back.
author: Tim F.

description:
Sadest kid in town. House of sushi was my staple place in SF. I started going here before I even lived in the city and now to read such miserable reviews.... oh my goodness.

I must say the bathrooms is the scarest experience ever but the food isnt as bad as you all say. Its the sweetest family ever who owns it and \they have a baby there we are convinced never ages and the food is crazy cheap. I will go back for hat home feeling I get but Wasabi Ginger about a block away is a better bet. 

Sorry House of Sushi.
author: Nancy B.

description: I got a good sized bowl of Udon here.  The prices are within reason.  It didn't seem too busy but then again, we went here early.  Our food came out quickly.  Not entirely bad, not entirely good either.  It's somewhere in the middle.
author: Amy J.

description:
Horrible. The sashimi smelled and tasted fishy. The rolls were rice-heavy and the fish was a disturbing shade of gray. Yes, I'm serious, GRAY. The chefs seemed nice enough. 

What does a woman have to do for a decent, *affordable* sushi spot in Russian Hizzy?
author: Defne A.

description:
I think one of the restaurant owners/employees was changing their baby about 10 feet from our table.  The smell of baby pooh with raw tuna was horrible. 

Not to mention that the fish didn't taste that fresh and the sushi chefs were both speaking Chinese to each other...

Terrible
author: Tim S.

description:
I was in a bit of a late night rut for dinner when I decided last minute to give House of Sushi a try.  I ordered two rolls, an eel rice and a beef udon.  I didn't try the udon, but I thought that the rolls were decent, and the eel and rice was pretty good.  The was reasonably priced, and the guy at the counter was incredibly nice.  

Even though I was placing a to-go order, one of the staff came by and gave me some tea to sip on while I waited.  The order didn't take long to fill.  The true testament?  I actually ate the eel rice as leftovers the next day - and it was still pretty good!  Granted, I am a big fan of leftovers.  But still.

It's not gourmet sushi, but for a neighborhood joint when you're at a loss as to what to eat, I'd stop by again.  I do admit though, it was slightly frustrating that they didn't get my check right the first time.  But oh well.
author: Shay F.

description: House of Sushi is a down to earth cosy place for a great every day Sushi with the family, friends or alone @ the bar - watching the Sushi chef prep the food with a smile on his face. The owner Michael is a great guy and I eat here for many years. This is not Nobu or a large hip place like Ozumo, if you look for a place like that you're @ the wrong place. House of Sushi is a cozy neighborhood gem that was the setting for uncountable great get togethers with tons of beer and unfiltered sake, or a perfect take out of home delivery for lazy days. Misu Soup, Seaweed Salad, Ikura, Godzilla, Tuna Sashimi & Dragon Roll with Saporro and cold unfiltered Saki in the wooden box for a very decent price - unbeatable for what it is!
author: Patrick E.

description:
3 and a 1/2 stars...but I rounded to 3 because the service can be a taad bit slow.
Its a good place though, really not warranting all the bad reviews.

 Its sad that so many people are hating this place.  We have been here several times and kind of forgot about it but last night we were starving and decided to hop in for a little sushi.  We had a really good meal.  The Hamachi Lover Roll was fabulous, the beef skewers were really tasty, the unagi was great and not over sauced...Service is good and friendly and its very reasonable.  
The sushi chef is really nice too. 
don't expect the best sushi ever...but for a quick meal around the block, its great.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Alas was fine mediocre sushi in a convenient location at a reasonable price.  They have some interesting cut rolls - the 4 Seasons was the best I tried.  The spicy tuna handroll fell apart.  Negihamachi was just ok.  Miso soup pretty good.  Alas the edamame were overcooked but we ate them all anyway as we were hungry.

Food comes out in random order.  Slow kitchen even when they were not particularly full.  Nice people working there but Kiss, Ino or Sebo this is not.

Partial bonus points for having the basketball game on as it was a night of the NBA finals.

They do take out as I saw several folks pick up to go orders....
author: Aaron T.

description: This is our go-to sushi place, and I've never been disappointed. Nice atmosphere and great sushi.
author: Jens A.

description:
I love this place. 

The meal was very enjoyable and the prices are very good for the neighborhood.
Services are wonderful, prompt, polite, and very fast. 

I am referring this place to my friends and always going back.
author: Martina S.

description:
This place looked small but inviting and the food was good for listed price. 

The reason I'm giving it such a bad rating, is that they are crooks. Although no sushi item is more than about 8 bucks on the menu, I ordered off of the specials menu (Hana roll on the outside chalkboard,  no price listed) and got duped on the check. They ended up charging me $12 for a roll without anything particularly expensive in it (albacore, avo, spice).

When I asked the manager what was the deal, he said "it was special, wasn't it?" with a smile on his face. They obvious pulled a fast one on me, but it shouldn't happen to anyone else.
author: P Z.

description: This place may be small, and it may not exactly be gourmet, but it's worth a trip just for the bento box dinner. For just $12.50 you get a bento box with miso soup, salad, rice, and your choice of 4 of the following: california rolls, sashimi, chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, tempura, tonkatsu, or gyoza. I've had the tempura and both the chicken and beef teriyaki, and they've all been delicious. I must say that I haven't been very impressed with their sashimi, but the california rolls are superb. After tax and tip, you're looking at a bill for just $15, which is a steal for the massive amount of food you get. That being said, it's relatively light, so you don't walk out of the restaurant feeling like someone needs to roll you down the street in order to get home. Try to grab a seat by the window for some prime Polk Street people-watching!
author: Katherine K.

description:
I have no idea what most of these other people are talking about, unless we live in alternate universes.  I frequently eat here.  I've brought my sister, parents, partner, and a co-worker there on different occasions and they've all enjoyed it.  My father in particular is a kind of Japanese food connoiseur, and he was quite pleased.  My sister is the kind of picky eater who eats maybe three dozen kinds of foods, and yet she will sometimes suggest we go there because she loves the teriyaki chicken so much.

No fishy smells or bugs in my salad and I've never gotten sick from the food, either.

I enjoy the rolls a lot.  The eel in the swamp roll is nice and tender.  

Serving time is pretty fast, too, both at tables and at the bar.  Personally I like to get my check quickly after I'm done, and this place likes to give its customers time to sit and relax after the meal, but I can't really complain about that.

In fact, my one complaint would the rest of the clientele.  Don't go there right after work on a weekday, it's not pleasant to listen to.
author: Argonaut A.

description:
House of Sushi is a great neighborhood find. The sushi is well-priced and good, and the service is friendly but slow.

My roomate and I go there for our cheap sushi nights, and I'm sure it's not the best sushi in town, but it's definitely good enough. I'm glad I found this little spot!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Found this spot as a default to another sushi spot we couldn't find. I guess we just settled here.  Didn't know what we were getting into until.....

We initially walked in...looked decent, saw the prices so we were sold.  Sat down at the sticky counter, and noticed the gnats circling us to welcome us to this place.

My girl ordered the an ice tea. didn't taste to good. hmm.. im scared now. 
ordered sushi. great portions, poorly assembled..hmmm. ordered some rolls...actually the spider roll was good.

My girl saw a sign that said, "New Dessert, Green Tea Cheesecake!"  She loves green tea anything. Brought out the dessert...wah wah...what a letdown.  The thing tasted like cardboard (and cost $7.00) Totally not worth it! Don't get it!

People were cool though.  The oranges they provided at the end of the meal was super good! oh well, you win some you lose some...
author: Lucky J.

description:
I read the "talk" section every so often when I'm board at work. There was this thread about what white people do or something like that. and one person said be picky about sushi. And i think the reviews about this place would fall under that. 

and if you have read some of my other reviews i keep reminding people about "you get what you pay for"!  if you want good sushi, you pay more for it. that being said. the sushi here is good for the price. 
i would recommend the combo dinners or the boxes.
