i usually go on nights that aren't so busy so the service is quick. 

go here if you need to fill your sushi fix and your not too picky.
author: Nate C.

description:
Atmosphere: great.
Staff: friendly.
Sushi: not great.

The miso soup was lukewarm at best and the tofu cubes in it were cold, like they had just been taken out of the fridge and dropped into the soup.  The sushi was flavorless for the most part and the fish was too cold.  The unagi nigiri was pretty good though.

In the end I ate every last piece of sushi because that's how I (dragon) roll so it wasn't sooo bad.  But I'll probably go to Wasabi & Ginger next.  This place is open late which is a plus.
author: Emile B.

description:
10 Reasons why I love HOUSE OF SUSHI: 
1. The spicy California roll is AMAZING and only $3.50
2. The owner Kazu is a great host and makes everyone feel at home, like they have been coming there for 20 years!!
3. Despite the fact that House of Sushi is family owned they don't care how drunk and loud you get off sake, they just keeping bringing you more.
4. The only sushi place I have been to that has ESPN on 24/7
5. Is open late every night! 
6. The teryaki beef and ahi are pretty damn good too :)
7. Is right next door to the Buc!
8. Three blocks from my hizzzzousseee!!!
9. Oregon roll is topped with super thin lemon slices and wasabi tobiko
10. So much better than Nara Sushi and not in Polk Ghetto,....I mean Gulch.
author: Andriana A.

description:
This place definitely fits the convenience mold, but doesn't go much further than that.  

I can imagine that the wait time here could be pretty long with a full house, as there was only 1 sushi chef when we were there and it took a while (definitely not a full house).  Pardon the Full House references.  Gyoza was tasty, but that could have been that they just deep fried it a bit much and I'm a sucker for most things fried. As for the sushi, mediocre at best.  I would come by for a quick tuna roll or something of the sort, but our hamachi roll was $12!  The menus are discumbobulated to say the least... there are some 'specials' on boards throughout the restaurant, and multiple menus floating around with different items.  Many lacking prices.  We got the hamachi lovers roll.  The menu indicated it would be spicy.  It wasn't spicy, and I would have guessed it was going to cost a maximum of $7.  But $12?  Come on.  For the service and quality, this place needs to step it up a bit.
author: William B.

description: Had I written this review after my FIRST experience at House of Sushi, it would have been a 2. In fact, I came home and explained to my boyfriend that I found it underwhelming at best. My boyfriend ended up going with a friend a few weeks later, only to tell me how GOOD it was... okay, there was clearly a mix up somewhere! Recognizing the real possibility that I just placed a bad order, we went back together and I let him do most of the ordering. I'm a bit embarrassed to admit that the first time I went in, I didn't really see the special rolls on the boards (my eyes are bad, gimme a break), but that's where the deliciousness lives. Those rolls are exceptional. Huge, satisfying and fairly affordable. We ordered two special rolls, one regular roll, miso soups and sunomono and were totally satisfied. I left a much happier camper than I did the time before and am happy to report that this will likely be one of our two sushi go-tos in the area now (Nara being the other one). There are lots of sushi places around but it's somewhat hard finding a place that's not overly trendy, fairly affordable and has the quality that you want when eating raw fish (am I right?). Based on my second experience, this place does it. Looking forward to our third visit... hoping they don't let me down!
author: Shannon E.

description:
I loooovvve greasy spoons on Sunday mornings - mmm, mmm!  Eggs, hash browns, cuppa joe.  Nothin' better!

Unfortunately, on this Friday eve, I realized that there's nothing charming about dirty dishes when the primary vittle (victual) on top of them is fresh fish.  House of Sushi is dirty.  Dir-tee!  With a capital "D".  Not just - "hey, they don't dust the chair rail very often.", rather "hey, look!  That man is using the same towel he cleaned our table with to wipe off the plate he's putting our sushi on."

Here's the quick rundown:

- Seated at a filthy table.  5 minute wait to get the dirty plates off.
- Tap water arrives.  My wife notes that the water/glass wreaks of fish.
- Wife spots man in kitchen wiping down plates with dirty dish rag
- Soy saucers arrive with wasabe residue and flecks of seaweed
- Sushi arrives on a dirty plate (boo!)

It was an evening of folly and famished folk and in the end we didn't have the fight left in us to get up and go at the first sign of trouble.  We were murderously hungry.  I'll never go again, and I hope you don't either.  I'll be contacting the health department.
author: Trick C.

description:
This is a solid place to come for an easy meal. Not worth going out of your way for- I only come here on random nights because I live within a few blocks. I've always been seated right away, and the food is always pretty good and the prices are reasonable.

I've only gotten delivery from House of Sushi once, and I would not recommend it. The food was late and cold, and they messed up part of our order.
author: Nicole V.

description: I live couple of blocks from this place and had dinner here with my wife tonight. The roll's were ok and the sashimi was good. To me its more of a 'take out sushi' place in the neighborhood.
author: Sam S.

description: I'd never gone here because whenever I went out for sushi my friends would always want to go to places with better reputations.  But a friend of mine was in from out of town and we decided to check the place out.  First of all, maybe it's not the best place in Russian Hill but I can't help notice how well-priced the menu was.  I've had a lot of sushi in my day and this place didn't leave me feeling disgusted.  I didn't leave thinking "great sushi" either.  Now the reason it gets 3 stars from me is the beer.  Now I don't usually drink beer but it turns out this place serves Orion Beer.  Orion Beer is from Okinawa.  It's somewhere between a microbrew and sapporo.  So if you're from Okinawa, definitely come here.  If you're in the mood for some cheap eats and want to speak some Japanese (sushi chef is Japanese), then also stop by.
author: John B.

description:
we went on an adventure.  check out my review of the charlie horse, ...the piano bar...  check my reviews for those as well.  maybe i'll link them later.

i'm gonna give this shit a 2.

i got like...well, i have a quote section from my brother, my best friend and my heterosexual life mate right here.  he'll tell you how it went:

"like a yellow duck in an aquaduct, just float on by."

my view is like this:  (also, i'm typing on a foreign keyboard, so please, i beg of you, excuse my typos)

i want to give it three stars.  i really do.  it was like this:  we walked in, we chatted for like two minutes, i saw the guy that owns the company i work for out the window, we talked about that...and still, STILL!, nobody had asked us if we would like something to drink.  you know, some tea?  some water?  some beer?  some sake?

no.  nothing.

the brief rundown is like this:  we walked in, the menus were sticky, not all of the bar seats were set with dishes and chopsticks and napkis, we waited for a while, the sushi chef (cool guy) asked us for our order, then somebody else later, asked us if we wanted drinks, i almost had to throw a plate at the guy to tell him we wanted edemame and gyoza as well.

the edemame was gross, the gyoza passable...they put vinegar on it (i think) rather than supplying us with a good dipping sauce...but the sushi.  the sushi, after i was able to think beyond the sticky menus and soft edemame...the sushi rolls were good.

although my brother would say too much imitation crab and mayonnaise...i enjoyed all of it but the rainbow roll (new york, alaska, 49er and rainbow).
author: Coe S.

description: We ended up here because the place we wanted to go to had a power outage. My rommate got stoned before we went, and she thought the food sucked. Imagine being stoned when you'll eat anything and thinking the food will suck. Then one of our other friends got a stomach ache, and then another one actually threw up later in the nite. So, all I can say is avoid this place.
author: Srinivas R.

description: After eating here, my friends and I knew we'd have to "yelp it" and we'd all give it 1 star.  My tummy never feels funny after eating sushi and it did after eating here!  AHHHH....GROSS!  My sister actually puked afterwards, granted we did sake bomb as well.  But we're tall Asian chicks who have extremely high tolerance for alcohol...the likelihood of her getting sick from sake & beer is close to "no way", so we're blaming it on the bad fish.  The service was quite slow and when we left, we left about 2 plates of spider rolls, and a plate of rainbow roll completely untouched.  I felt bad for the waiter since we bonded, but really...I just couln't pretend I liked the sushi.  Sorry...
author: Wendy H.

description: Boring... Most of the stuff on the menu is cheap but it's also really small portions, like 4 pieces per roll. The miso soup was luke warm and had no flavor at all. I've never had to add soy sauce to miso before. The stuff on the specials board is way over priced. I've ordered the beef udon before togo and it was great and cheap. Only go here if your to drunk to stumble to another restaurant, and only order the udon.
author: Az A.

description:
Once seated my 3 friends and I noticed right away that the empty plates given to us looked like they were licked clean. Dried crusty nastyness all over 2 of 4 that were on the table. 

THE FOOD
I am vegan so all I eat are veggies rolls. It is really hard to mess that up but somehow they did. First off my rolls had mayo on them. WTF? 

They charged $12 for 8 rolls in my Veggie Combo rolls which consisted of 4 different veggies. Thats not much of a combo in my eyes. 

None of us finished our meal and one friend ate one roll and stopped. His rolls smelled so bad that he lost his interest in eating. 

Once we were done, my girlfriend asked for a slice of green tea cheesecake. HAHAHA this is the best part of the visit. It was served to her with a plastic spoon and frozen to the core, rock hard. The man who brought it out was the owner. He was dressed in shorts way too short for any man to wear, flip flops and a stained t-shirt. Once we brought it to his attention that the cheesecake was solid he then told us "its supose to be like that?" HA! And all this time I had been eating cheesecake while it was soft and silk like. All these years I had been eating cheesecake incorrectly. THANKS SUSHI HOUSE!

What a waste of time and money this place was. I wouldn't serve this crap in a soup kitchen.
author: Jaysin B.

description: Favorite sushi place on polk st. The snow roll is amazing and the fried octopus. The service is sometimes not amazing, esp. when it's crowded, but the food is always good.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Ventured into the place after a long walk. It was pretty busy, so we waited about fifteen minutes for a table open up. 

Service: a little slow--I really think the guy was filling in....

Food: The Gyozas were perfect! They were crispy on the outside, which is a change from the mushy ones I've had more often.
I got the Rock N Roll and the Futo roll. The Rock N Roll was pretty standard, the teriyaki-glaze dribbled on top was a little syrupy. The Futo roll never made it to the table... He served me their Super California Roll and when I mentioned this, he corrected me and said, no, it was the Futo roll...but followed it with "I don't really know". Kinda strange. My boyfriend got the Chicken Teriyaki/Sashimi/California Roll/Tempura Bento box. The tuna looked incredibly fresh and was very generously portioned--large chunks of very fresh fish.

We got Sake, hot, which was tasty and green tea ice cream for dessert-- one scoop which was definitely enough after eating all that food!

I would go back, but maybe make sure I am really clear with what I want to order...
author: Sarah H.

description: I am trying to expand my restaurants and decided to try this sushi place this weekend.  EXTREMELY disappointed.  I wasn't expecting the most fabulous sushi ever, but I was expecting easy, but pretty good.  Well, it was just boring, not that good and everything seems to have crab in it, or on it.  The least appealing thing was one of the workers had their baby with them and the child had gone to the bathroom so the entire dining room smelled like poop.  Try eating while smelling someone else's poop.  I lost my appetite pretty quickly and feel very confident saying I wont be back.
author: Jaime C.

description: The sushi is decent enough but plenty of better sushi in the city. I'm giving it three stars though for the ultra friendly service. It seems like a mom and pop kind of place and everyone says hi to you and they really seem quite sincere. The staff elevates the experience for me so three stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: wow a little surprised by the 2.5 stars.  we came here for a quick bite and was surprised by how good it was.  good prices, good sushi....especially the dragon roll and the spicy toro roll.  good price, good sushi, what more do you want on a monday night before a movie???  i'd come back...why not?  better than some of the other sushi places on polk...
author: Mao K.

description: I used to go here a lot for the reasonably-priced sushi, but I quit going when it started to smell very fishy when I walked in. To me a good indicator of the quality of a sushi place is the lack of a fishy smell.
author: Allison B.

description: I usually enjoy coming to this place for their bento boxes, but the last visit has really left me baffled. The service was lacking and the food a disappointment. The sushi chef and owner were nice, but they did not fulfill their duties in providing service. My gf and I ordered tuna sashimi without the rice, but we received rice. It took about 15 minutes for that plate to come. When we told them about the mistake, it took another 10 minutes for them to correct it. The rainbow roll came late. The beef in the bento box was not cooked well, very rare. Sad to say, this is probably the last time i'll come back here. I was not impressed with the food or service. Tip is earned, not mandatory.
author: Wil M.

description: Let me put it this way. I've had much better sushi at sushi rocks!!!
author: Ghiz S.

description: 3.5 stars: I got a bento box with gyoza, california roll, tuna sashimi, and tonkatsu for about $12 for dinner in San Francisco.  The yelp reviews are pretty low (2.5 stars) but I thought it was quite good especially for the money.  The tea was weak (as in the tea leaves are used too many times).  I liked the rice, which was sticky.  Fish was fresh.  It wasn't crowded on a Friday night.
author: David L.

description:
3 stars for food, an extra star for service.

I ordered the California Roll and New York Roll (I don't like raw fish). New York Roll was kind of blah, but I have yet to find a place that made a good one anyway. The California Roll was very good though; the healthy serving of crab was smothered in mayo (I LOVE mayo).

My boyfriend ordered his usual and he got a mixed response. The waitress did recommend the butterfish and he seemed to have liked it. I think we'll have to come back a second time to be sure on the quality of the fish.

The waitress refilled our cups several times while we were there and that's a big plus in my book. I mean yeah, it's kind of bothersome to have someone come by every so often to interrupt your dinner to fill your cups, but then again, it's not a good experience either if I'm left parched, so I settle for the former.

I could see myself coming back again even though the place is a bit of a dive.
author: Richard C.

description: For $10 you get a dinner combo - chicken terriyaki and 6 pieces of sushi. I didnt expect much but it was surprisingly very good sushi for the average sushi restaurant (I also ordered the spyder roll). You also get soup with the combo. Ill definitely go here again, the only thing is it takes much longer than I'd expect. Its a very small place and seems to draw solo eaters.
author: Jared M.

description: Frankly, I don't know and I don't care if this place is any good.  My grandparents live in the retirement community around the corner and this is where my dad and I always escape to on extended family visits.  I'm quite fond of this place just because it's a setup for the rarity of one-on-one Frankie-Dad time.  Plus, dad buys me all the sushi I can possibly stomach.
author: Frankie D.

description: This review is based on my carry-out experience with the udon. It was horrible. $8+ for what amounted to one of those $1.99 Annie Chung bowls you get from TJ's. No vegetables or anything, just some small bits of chicken and a few slices of green onion. The broth was unmemorable.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This has to be one of the worst sushi restaurants I have ever been to. The fish is not fresh and I found a huge bug in my salad and will never go back!
author: A D.

description: They used to be much better. In the past few months they've gone down hill. I think they lost their principal sushi chef. The guy who seems to be doing now is much less experienced than the old guy. Hope they get better as they're in a great location and they're always friendly. As for the sushi itself, we've been there 2 or 3 times since they started to go downhill and have been disappointed every time.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Absolutely horrifying! Just moved into the neighborhood and wanted to try and new sushi place. It was certainly my first and the last. Terrible decor. Unfresh fishes. You know when your raw fish doesn't taste right. I cannot warn you enough not to eat here.
author: benjamin c.

description: Friendly sushi chef, good service.  It was the only place open serving food after the fireworks on Independence Day this year (2007), and my entourage and I stepped in for a bite.  I LOVED the hamachi lovers' roll (I had two orders--two rolls each) and the maguro and hamachi sushi were top-notch.  I tasted some of my friends' seaweed salad, which was very nice, and enjoyed the sake (very sweet).  I give four stars only because the space is a tad small, and the sushi chef wasn't wearing traditional costume, though he was fun to practice Japanese with.  The sushi I had was excellent, though.
author: Jeff G.

description: Went to House of Sushi a few weeks ago and was highly unimpressed. It was a group dinner for party of 8. We were seated at the front of the restaurant next to the entrance and window to the establishment. The decor looked decent, food was okay, and service was horrendously poor. It was hard for me to rate this restaurant any better given the 1+ hour wait for standard table service of ice waters, place settings, and reasonable wait time for drinks/food. There was only one guy waiting tables, one sushi chef, and one bus boy/kitchen cleaner. I found it was seriously understaffed and horribly clueless to what nice restaurants' offer. I would not like to come to this restaurant ever again despite the reasonable pricing and food. The waiting, waiting, more waiting was teeth-cringing unbearable and lack of attention we were even in the restaurant in the first place was just unbelievable overall. I highly DO  NOT recommend this place to anyone. San Francisco has so many great sushi places to go to and this is definitely not one of them. Sorry.
author: L C.

description: Mediocre quality sushi.  Lots of flies were circling around inside the establishment.  Would not come back.
author: Lisa X.

description: This place seems to specialize in the more Authentic aspects Japanese sushi. Don't get one of those crazy Americanized rolls, he makes them to please the herds. The sashimi and nigiri are well tenderized and fresh. The Oysters on the half shell are the best I've found in the city. The owner is a friendly and welcoming man. He seems to remember any face that has come through his door.
author: miranda m.

description: *nasty!!!!!*  we were headed to street for dinner, but it was closed b/c of a power outage (how does that work...only one restaurant on all of polk closed for a power failure??).  anyway, i was in no way part of the decision making process that led us to 'house of sushi,' but there we were sitting at the bar.  service was in ordinately slow (but i was not quite in a state to gauge time...see srinivas' review:  i'm the roommate).  once the food came out, it was heinously disappointing.  the golden california rolls tasted like cardboard, the california rolls were stale, and i wouldn't even venture near the nigiri (and thank goodness i didn't b/c the members of our group who did, ended up really sick).  if you want quality dining, avoid this restaurant like the plague!
author: Roshni R.

description: Um. So. I had a brief love affair with this little place when I first moved here and it endeared itself to me with its cozy, simple atmosphere and its very cheap sushi. But. It's just really not good. Their special rolls are actually quite expensive, and their regular rolls vary wildly in quality, and can come out quite gross and warm. Cute, but seriously, for like a  couple dollars more, you can get much better sushi.
author: Jessi C.

description: Seaweed salad I thought was good, salmon sashimi was good, and we were half way through the two rolls we'd ordered (house special roll and something else) when I saw a cockroach crawling on the soy sauce bottle. I have never seen a cockroach at a restaurant before. I was and am still mortified. This was two days ago.
author: erik l.

description: Good tasting sushi but the restaurant itself always smells like fish (and not in a good way). The wait staff is very friendly though.
author: Brenda S.

description: Um, why does this place only have 2 1/2 stars...this place is great!!  If you like restaurants with a homey-feel and friendly service, then you'll like house of sushi.  The sushi was awesome, ginger was fresh, and the restaurant was pretty clean.  I recommend the hamachi (or your preferred fish) nigiri and the tempura udon.  Their tempura was so crisp and fresh, I can just imagine eating it right now and soaking it up in their sauce..mmmm.  The sushi chef was really nice and the price isn't too bad for sushi either.
author: Trisha H.

description: Great inexpensive sushi in a small setting on Polk at Vallejo. Staff is super nice. This is a great place to try!
author: Michael L.

description: This place is hit and miss.  Sometimes I really like it and sometimes I'm not so impressed.  Also there is a little bit of a fruit fly problem that they will hopefully address sometime soon.
author: Richard C.
